intro: Yushania qiaojiaensis var. nuda, commonly known as the naked yushania, is a flowering plant species native to the Yunnan province in China. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright culms and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale green to brownish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, typically in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
